edu.uci.calismall

Interface JSONSerializable<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of objects that are returned as an output of the deserialization
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CaliSmall, CaliView, RectStroke, Scrap, Scrap.Temp, Stroke

    public interface JSONSerializable<T>
    An object that can be serialized to JSON format.

    The type information is used to let deserialization of subtypes happen: if the deserialization results in an object of a subtype, that object can be created and return by the fromJSON(JSONObject) method. Otherwise, this is going to be returned.

    Author:
    Michele Bonazza

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T fromJSON(JSONObject jsonData)
      Populates all fields in the argument newObject with data retrieved from jsonData.
      JSONObject toJSON()
      Serializes this object to JSON format.

    • Method Detail

      • toJSON

        JSONObject toJSON()
                  throws JSONException
        Serializes this object to JSON format.
        Returns:
        the newly created JSONObject containing all data that is ready to be stored on disk/sent through the network
        Throws:
        JSONException - if anything goes wrong while serializing this object

      • fromJSON

        T fromJSON(JSONObject jsonData)
           throws JSONException
        Populates all fields in the argument newObject with data retrieved from jsonData.
        Parameters:
        jsonData - an object parsed from a JSON string
        Returns:
        the object that was populated with all data coming from the JSON representation
        Throws:
        JSONException - if anything goes wrong while parsing data from JSON
